subject: Education
title: India's Right to Education: Ambition Meets Reality
description: A quick, practical guide to India's Right to Education: Ambition Meets Reality.

hook.text: India made education a constitutional right in 2009. Enrollment surged. Learning didn't.

buildup.text: The Right to Education Act mandated free schooling for all children aged 6-14.

discovery.text: Getting children into schools proved easier than ensuring they actually learned to read and write.

twist.text: No-detention policies meant children advanced through grades regardless of literacyâ€”hiding the problem.

climax.text: NGOs like Pratham showed that targeted 'teaching at the right level' can close gaps in weeks.

punchline.text: The right to education means nothing without the right to learn.

quiz.question: What was the main limitation of India's Right to Education Act?
options: It increased enrollment but didn't ensure actual learning outcomes
It only applied to private schools
